result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Physical Abuse of Elder Person - Intentionally Cause Bodily Harm

records.addlTxt:
9:39 AM Defendant Samuel R Turner in court.  Prosecuting attorney Hector Al-Homsi in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is eligible for SPD but has not yet been appointed counsel, requested adjournment. No objection.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
Status conference on November 21, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Samuel R Turner
Current: 4 N Hancock St, Madison, WI 53703 United States  (Effective: 10-21-2022)
Prior: 2901 International Ln Apt 100, Madison, WI 53704

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with TS.
- Defendant shall not be at Culvers at 2102 W Beltline Hwy in Madison.
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial Judge - Br 12

2:35 PM Defendant Samuel R. Turner in court, in custody.  Attorney Guy Cardamone in court for Samuel R. Turner.  Prosecuting attorney Thersa Louise Lewandowski in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 09:30 am.
